intro: Pseudodictamnus mediterraneus, commonly known as the Mediterranean false dittany, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has aromatic leaves and stems, which are often used in traditional herbal medicine. It typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in Mediterranean flora.
